title: Line breaks in location field of ICS file needs to be converted
body:
### Problem and impact

When I insert an address with multiple lines in the event location field, the linebreak `\n` in the downloaded ICS file gets ignored by the calendar apps and the address is written without any space.
In most apps the location field is only one line.

If I insert the following address in the event location:
```
Party Location
Partystreet 4
12345 Party
```
the address in Outlook or Thunderbird looks like this:
```
Party LocationPartystreet 412345 Party
```
So the apps can't find this address in a navigation app.

E.g. Google replaces `\n` with `\, ` in their ICS files.

### Expected behaviour

I insert the following address in the event location:
```
Party Location
Partystreet 4
12345 Party
```
so I expect the address in Outlook or Thunderbird of the ICS file looks like this:
```
Party Location, Partystreet 4, 12345 Party
```

### Steps to reproduce

1. Insert event location with multiple lines
2. Download ICS file of event
3. Open ICS file in calendar app (e.g. Outlook or Thunderbird)

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Link

_No response_

### Browser (software, desktop or mobile?) and version

_No response_

### Operating system, dependency versions

_No response_

### Version

4.15.0

body: **Describe the bug** When creating a new Event in Firefox, the zoom buttons of the Map embed are layed out on top of the date picker and may block clicks on certain dates. **Expected behavior** The zoom buttons should be layout out below the timepicker overlay. **Screenshots** **Additional context** - Latest Firefox on latest MacOS

The max amount field also accepts values like -1, which might actually break things in a worse way, just a side note though.

pretix version 4.6.0

title: Regression: File question required when editing ticket
body:
This is the same issue as #1408, I'm not quite sure whether this should be a new bug because it's a regression or if the old bug should be reopened?

Long story short: We noticed in Pretix 4.3 that customers editing their order will be faced with file questions being `required` even though they have uploaded a file for that question already. The requirement comes from the `input` being marked as `required` and the browsers refusing to submit the form without something in there.

This was fixed in #1443, but it seems this doesn't work anymore. I haven't had time to look into this more, so I don't have a clue where it might fail.

title: Is SV correct translation folder for Sweden?
body:
Hi,
I see that the translations for Swedish is stored in the "locale/sv/LC_MESSAGES"-folder.
According to http://www.i18nguy.com/unicode/language-identifiers.html it should be "SE", or am I wrong?
When enabling SV in my dev environment, I get the sv.png flag (which is El Salvador)

title: ShredDownloadView delivers .zip als PDF
body:
The PDF that is provided by `ShredDownloadView` through the cachedfiles.DownloadView pushes the .zip-File as `content-type: application/pdf`.

This confuses some browsers, making them save the file as a PDF.

title: The order of products is not stable between event page, cart, checkout
body:
The event page will show products in the order defined for products in the event settings, the cart at the top of the event page and the checkout pages will not always show the same order. This was confusing to me when I first noticed it :-)

As best I can surmise the products in the cart are sorted in the order the products were created (I can't say if this is by ID or by whatever order the DB happens to return). The products seem to be in the same order they have been added to the cart on the checkout pages (same as before, can't say if it's intentionally sorted by ID or whatever order the DB returns). It is very confusing that products are sorted differently in different parts of the app.

We noticed that the vouchers are not being displayed. They are still noted when they have been used in orders, they are still counted in the voucher tags, and are still usable for new orders.

title: Unexpected beahviour of product variations and minimum amount
body:
I want to set up a group ticket.
I set up a product P with a minimum amount of 10 and the two variations A and B.
When trying to order e.g. 2x A and 8x B, the cart won't be created with the error message that at least 10 items need to be ordered.
However, I am able to add say 2x A and 10x B and cart will be created. I can then reduce B by two to 2x A and 8x B and cart is still valid.
This seems not to be an intended behaviour. I would expect the cart to be created when the sum of both variations is equal or greater then the threshold.

title: forms.NullBooleanSelect not rendering current selection
body:
The `ShowQuotaNullBooleanSelect`-widget, used in the items settings ("Show number of tickets left") is not appending the `selected` property to any choice.

This leads to a user being able to select any of the choices, saving the form and then having the quota displayed accordingly in the presale. However, in the backend the display defaults back and with the next save the setting is overriden to the default again.

Edit: Also applies to `TicketNullBooleanSelect` - so at this point probably all `forms.NullBooleanSelect`-fields.

Z#2351209

title: Question: Is it possible to change the customer's name? (typo etc.)
body:
Hey there, me again...

I was wondering, if there is a possibility to change the name of a customer.
Although we do not ask for the customer's address or create an invoice, in the ordering process you have to type in your first and last name. Now, some people enter their full name in both fields, which results in something like "John Doe John Doe" or have a typo in the spelling.

Trying to correct these "mistakes" I wanted to use the "change" link at the invoice information of the affected order (in the back-end), because the customer's name is displayed there.
![01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22148307/66296286-7fc4ae00-e8ed-11e9-81e7-efbf4a247102.jpg)

But then there is no possibility to change the name. It is not even displayed.
![02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22148307/66296371-b26ea680-e8ed-11e9-9ad2-bb19d23d1471.jpg)

I guess, it is not intended to correct / change the name of a customer, because of reasons with the invoice etc.. And probably because we don't ask for an address, there is nothing displayed to change anyway.

Thank you in advance!

title: Use proper MIME structure
body:
Since #1358, we've been sending emails with a MIME structure like this:

```
multipart/related
   multipart/alternative
      text/plain
      text/html
   image/png (images for HTML content)
   application/pdf (tickets)
   …
```

Unfortunately, this broke attachments on Apple devices entirely: iOS Mail no longer showed any attachments. As a quick fix, in ca0c0f4ae, I changed ``multipart/related`` to ``multipart/mixed``. This has the upside of showing all attachments again, but the downside of showing the PNG images as attachments as well.

The correct structure would look like this:

```
multipart/mixed
   multipart/alternative
      text/plain
      multipart/related
         text/html
         image/png (images for HTML content)
   application/pdf (tickets)
   …
```

I verified that this yields the correct results on iOS. What's left to do is changing our code to generate this structure and verify that it works as intended in at least GMail and Outlook.

title: Stripe PaymentIntent.state: "pending" should be "processing" ?
body:
Hello!

Not sure it's a real issue, but I stumbled on this while reading the new Stripe plugin PaymentIntent code:

https://github.com/pretix/pretix/blob/262fb822376bfb555ac7b5fc82463e166daad218/src/pretix/plugins/stripe/payment.py#L726

There is no state `pending` in the stripe docs for PaymentIntent, only `processing` (contrary to Charge.state which can be `pending`):
https://stripe.com/docs/payments/intents

Feel free to close if I missed something and the code is valid!

body: i wanted to use an internal name for a product categorie, it was saved and i can edit it, but it is not used in the backend list of all categories

title: Girocode must not contain Umlauts
body:
Where as the Bezahlcode allows for DTAUS-compatible charset (incl. German Umlaute), the Girocode does not. Girocodes containing such characters (like in "Stadtsparkasse München") get rejected by most banking apps.

We should either rewrite everything to plain text or at at least show a warning.

title: Document nav_event capabilities
body:
The `nav_event` documentation doesn't mention that you can pass a `"parent"` attribute, which will be used to (hierarchically) put entries under existing entries. This is a highly useful feature and documenting it would be very appreciated.

---

Please also mention that any entry capable of containing child entries must have an empty `"children": []` list, because without it, pretix will crash.

---

Oh, and while I'm here, I'm sure you'll want to hear about this very interesting bug! If you actually use this feature, as @raphaelm did in the plugin prtx-faq, pretix might make your life very hard indeed if a child link has the same url as the parent link and is *first, alphabetically*. This is because pretix sorts all additional link alphabeticlly by label before merging them.

title: BUG: Stripe confirms payment, yet fails in Pretix
body:
Stripe reports a payment authorised, but in pretix the first event in the order history says that payment failed. Mere seconds later the payment is confirmed.

Unfortunately, the customer sees the failure on his/her screen..
In our case (event sold out in 2 hours) many people who got into this situation thought the whole registration procedure failed and bought a second ticket (and a 3rd, 4th ...)

In the second image you can see what the user sees in such condition. Instead of going to the order link, and error message pops up on the screen and the the home page of the event is shown.. So I understand the confusion of the customer.

![Screen Shot 2019-03-26 at 16 27 56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/485492/55010340-5349e400-4fe4-11e9-9ac7-42561e92c35c.png)

![foutmelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/485492/55010636-d53a0d00-4fe4-11e9-9436-d95ae1caee10.jpg)

title: Rest API remarks
body:
I found some inconsistencies the the rest-api documentation:

**Items --> Resource description**

picture --> string --> does not mention it can be null

original_price --> string --> does not mention it can be null

**Item variations --> Resource description**

price --> string --> the returned value is not a string but a number


I mention this because my backend marshals api data into typed data and knowing if certain types can be null is critical.

I have not tested all feedback in all conditions, so there might still be other issues.

title: Invalidate ticket cache after the order locale has been changed
check-in list displays wrong email address
body:
When I display a check-in list in the browser, I will not see email address of the participant, but the one from the user who will get the invoice.
However, when I export the same check-in list, I will get the correct email addresses in the exportet data.

I would think that this is a bug and the online visible check-in lists should show the email addresses of the participants too.

title: Order payment received email sent twice
body:
When in general settings:
selecting -> Ask for the order email address twice

The Payment Received e-mail is sent twice.

When unselecting that option, the payment received e-mail is sent once

The Order Received e-mail is sent once in both cases, so that one is correct.

title: field 'Titel' should not be mandatory
body:
When I edit an order in the backend, the system does not allow an empty input in the field 'Titel' (german name of the field)
When the customer inputs his/her order in the frontend, the field is not mandatory.

Pretix should allow an empty input in the backend too.

body:

Comparing to https://github.com/pretix/pretix/blob/master/doc/development/api/general.rst#backend, for example all the `html` and `navbar`-signals are missing...

title: 405 when adding to cart on small screen
body:
Given you have a smaller screen, pretix does not display an iframe on the same page, but does open a new tab. That request results in a `405` ([Firefox request recording, `.txt` due to github constraints](https://github.com/pretix/pretix/files/2451435/pretix.har.txt)).

## How to reproduce?

1. Open Firefox (other browser are possible, but have different tool names and shortcuts)
2. Go to [`https://docs.pretix.eu/en/latest/user/events/widget.html`](https://docs.pretix.eu/en/latest/user/events/widget.html)
3. Delete cookies for the site (`Shift + F9`)
4. Reload
5. Press `F12`
6. Enable `Responsive Design Mode` (`Ctrl + Shift + M`)
7. Click `Buy`
8. Firefox will display a blank page, if you are quick enough to press `F12` you will see the `405` error under `Networking` (`Ctrl + Shift + E`)

title: SMTP test is misleading
body:
The output I got in the webinterface was:

```
Ein Fehler trat auf beim Versuch, den SMTP-Server zu erreichen: {}
```

What actually happened was this:

```
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: > 220 mail.sf-mail.de Qsmtpd 0.34dev ESMTP
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: < ehlo xxx
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: > 250-mail.sf-mail.de
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: > 250-ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: > 250-PIPELINING
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: > 250-8BITMIME
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: > 250-STARTTLS
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: > 250 SIZE
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: < STARTTLS
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: > 220 2.0.0 ready for tls
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: <e ehlo xxx
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: >e 250-mail.sf-mail.de
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: >e 250-ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: >e 250-PIPELINING
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: >e 250-8BITMIME
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: >e 250-AUTH LOGIN PLAIN
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: >e 250 SIZE
Sep 16 13:18:18 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: <e rcpt TO:<test@example.org>
Sep 16 13:18:23 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: >e 503 5.5.1 Bad sequence of commands
```

Bad sequence of commands, the "rcpt to" doesn't make any sense here.

```
Sep 16 13:18:23 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: <e mail FROM:<xxx>
Sep 16 13:18:23 mail Qsmtpd[1775]: >e 250 2.1.5 sender <xxx> is syntactically correct
```

title: Preventing user enumeration
body:
It is currently possible to enumerate emails of team members using the password reset feature. The view should return in both cases (email known/unknown) the same message, to prevent this risk.

**Side effects:**
- No "There was an error sending the mail" exception for the user anymore. This information could be logged.
- No "We've already sent you an email in the last 24 hours." displayed to the user anymore.  
- Two new messages for the user. For example:  
"We have sent you an e-mail containing further instructions, if you own a valid account." (no redis instance available)
"We have sent you an e-mail containing further instructions, if you own a valid account. You can reset the password once every 24 hours. " (redis instance available)

If there are no objections, I would start implementing the described behaviour.

title: “Paid tickets per quota” does not show paid orders count for unlimited quota
body:
In the Event overview (/control/events/), the “Paid tickets per quota” column shows the “pending orders“ count rather than the “paid orders“ count for quotas with unlimited total capacity.

The pending orders count is assigned to the quota's `cached_availability_paid_orders` property in https://github.com/pretix/pretix/blob/master/src/pretix/base/models/items.py#L1014, but it's not clear to me if this is a typo or deliberately.

Is the pending orders count used by design or by mistake?

Best regards,
Mikkel

title: Selecting "flexible price" for a product negates any discount given with vouchers
body:
Our current Situation: 
we have a ticet in the shop which has three subversions. As soon as flexible pricing for the product is enabled, none of the discount options vouchers give you apply. Neither setting the price to a fixed value for the voucher nor entering a %-discount works.
As soon as flexible pricing gets turned off the vouchers apply as expected.
This happens for us on v1.15.0, propably on older versions as well ( i havent checked)
It also only happens if you have multiple versions enabled and for sale, if i create a single Ticket with flexible pricing the vouchers work.

title: Entry time cannot be set correctly when event starts at 0:00
body: I want to start an event at 0:00. In that case the entry time can only set not earlier than 0:00 at the same day. Creating an entry time earlier is not allowed.

title: Removing cart position after end of subevent presale period
body: I have an item of an event which lies in the past in my cart. When I try to remove it (e.g. by clicking "empty cart"), I get an error message stating that the presale period has ended.

title: Check-in list include unpaid option in subevent detail view
body:
All properties of a check-in list linked to a subevent can be altered in the subevents detail view. The option `include unpaid` is new, but can't be edited there.

This also has the effect that when duplicating a subevent, the attribute value `include unpaid` of the check-in list isn't copied over to the form.

title: Error when logging in as a super user - Please help.
body:
Hi all,

I hope you can help me.I have just had Pretix installed on my server under cloudlinux.
The issue I have is that when I log in as a super user e.g admin@localhost, I get an Internal Server Error.

title: Update docs with P3P support
body:
On my website I'm using the Pretix widget to allow users to buy tickets. While testing with Internet Explorer 11 I came across a behaviour where the browser wouldn't accept a cookie from the ticket system. 

It turned out to be an issue with something called `P3P` (which I never heard before). Anyways, I had to set a custom header before IE11 accepted the cookies. Maybe you want this in the docs somewhere:

```
Header set P3P "CP=\"ALL DSP COR CUR ADM TAI OUR IND COM NAV INT\""
```

Reference P3P: https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/ieinternals/2013/09/17/a-quick-look-at-p3p/

title: TypeError when redeeming voucher at subevent overview
body:
**What I did** 🔧 
I have an event series called `testseries` under the organizer `bigevents`. Naturally, the event can be seen at `http://localhost:8000/bigevents/testseries/`. 

I have a voucher for the event with subevents `testseries` which is not tied to a specific subevent. I paste the voucher code in the field on `http://localhost:8000/bigevents/testseries/`.

**What happened** 💥 
I get a type error stating that a subevent must be provided. ([Stack Trace](http://dpaste.com/2PZW8K0))

**What I expected** 🤔 
I expected the website to report a userfriendly error that I should select a subevent before trying to redeem the voucher.

Using a voucher works fine under an URL tied to a specific subevent, e.g. `http://localhost:8000/bigevents/testseries/3/`. 👍

title: Waiting list voucher created despite payment timeframe already closed
body:
Not sure whether this is a bug, a missing logic check or plain user error.

I had an event with a waiting list, and a last day of payments set up. Now one order expired after said date, and a new voucher for the next one on the waiting list was generated and sent out.

Is there a scenario in which that makes sense? Why would I sell a ticket, when someone is not allowed to pay for it anymore?

title: Order code splitted at wrong character during bank transfer assignment
body:
Just ran into an issue while manually resolving an unresolved transaction. When I enter the order code of the transaction (just the 5 characters) into the input field, a dropdown opens up to reveal the order. This includes the entire string with the name of the event, the full transfer description that should have been used by the payer. When I click it, this entire description is filled into the input field. When I click confirm however, pretix does not recognize this string. Instead it just wants the 5 characters.

So either clicking the recommendation in the dropdown should just insert the 5 characters instead of the entire transfer string, or the input field should accept both. I guess the second option would be the nicer one.

Sorry I didn't take any screenshots, by the time I had solved my issue, it was already too late ;)

When rotating secrets, the corresponding ticket-PDFs in cache are invalidated and generated from scratch when a new download is requested.

However the combined PDF with all tickets is not invalidated and keeps getting served - old secrets and all.

title: Voucher not being counted correctly
body:
In the voucher by tag overview, the number sometimes just don't add up ;-)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/654548/28206928-1c7ff030-6888-11e7-8891-14e5c794e730.png)

So the progressbar is showing nothing, because it's class is set to 200%. Okay, that's kinda expected to not work ;-)

Explanation for the numbers:
- 2: Two vouchers are created with this tag
- 4: Those two vouchers have been redeem twice each.

So I guess we have to decide if the overview should show the amount of vouchers or the amount of possible voucher redemptions.

title: CVC for Stripe-payments is limited to 3 chars
body:
When using the inline-form to process Stripe-payments, there is a tiny issue with the CVC:

While most CC-companies agreed on 3 digits for the CVC, Amex has to roll their own way and actually sets their CVCs to 4 digits.

Right now, the form will not allow the user to enter that 4th digit.

IIRC, right now pretix is using the v2-API... This problem could probably be solved by either upgrading to v3 and using the "Stripe Elements" that do all kind of animations and magic (such as correctly limiting the CVC-field based on the card brand) or by implementing a filter, that allows 4-digits if the PAN starts with either 34 or 37.

title: Issue while updating pretix
body:
While updating pretix (Small-scale manual deployment) from Version 1.4.0 to 1.5.0 some pip packages won't install automatically and need to be installed manually.

Otherwise there are errors while migrating to 1.5

``(venv) pip3 install djangoframework``
``(venv) pip3 install django-filter``

fixes the issue for me.

Debian 8 Kernel 3.16.0-4

title: Moving multiple elements at the same time screws with PDF-output
body:
When selecting multiple elements in the PDF-editor and moving them collectively (with the arrow-keys), they will move as expected.

However upon previewing, the moved objects are placed completely at a wrong place.

Saving the whole thing again however (without refreshing; with the fields placed correctly in the editor), and then running a new preview, everything is fine.

This whole thing gets only cumbersome, when the objects are moved (internally) off-canvas, the editor is reloaded and the fields are not reachable anymore. (Hint: ``editor.fabric.dispose()`` gets rid of everything and resets to the default Pretix-layout. Perhaps we should add that as a "Reset ticket"-button).

allo wit -> allow it

title: Ordering tickets after payment period
body:
In my test setup, I ran into this issue:

 - I was within my presale period, but outside my accepted payment period
 - I bought a ticket with a voucher
 - After successful ordering, my order page showed the order status as 'Pending' and notified me, that my chosen payment method (`None` when I used a voucher with price 0, by the way) should have already been completed and could not be accepted anymore.

While this configuration is unlikely to appear in the wild, I'd call this at the very least a UI bug, regarding the "None Please complete your payment before <date>." when redeeming a free voucher.

Imo, a payment provider that is not usable anymore should not be selectable in the payment process.

![2017-06-18-143358_1188x920_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2657547/27260716-8cdcc380-5433-11e7-98aa-cfe0d0d7bc78.png)

title: Wrong alias path for python3.4
Invoices: Deal with long event slugs
Admin email getting set to empty string, breaking login
body:
One of the admins of our pretix instance recently complained about not being able to log in anymore. After a bit of testing I had a look at the database and noticed the `email` field for the user was empty. Since the login is email-based, that of course breaks it.

![2017-04-04-17 22 13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/179393/24664723/affa6362-195b-11e7-967d-acf2fa2d32a6.png)

I definitely didn't manually remove the email using the Django shell or in the database, so I'm not really sure how it happened. If you have any ideas, I'm happy to debug. After manually setting the email in the database the login worked again.

Potentially relevant:
* That account was the only one that had 2fa enabled.
* We have multiple superusers / accounts with `is_staff` set to true. I'm not sure if that's supported, but it worked so far.
* That account was the only one with a `fullname` set.
* I run pretix with Postgres

title: Enforce currencies to be a valid ISO code
body:
**Hey!** If you ever wanted to contribute to an Open Source project, but didn't know how, you just found a perfect place to start. We try to write this issue as instructive as possible, but as we're humans we almost certainly forgot to write something important in here. If you want to try to tackle this issue and get stuck at _any_ point, please do not hesitate and ask us, either here on GitHub or via email at support@pretix.eu. We'll be very happy to help! 

We think this issue is very suitable to people who are just starting with Python or Django development or who never contributed to Open Source before. We'd like to ask people with wide experience in these areas to leave this issue to beginners. Thanks! (If you want something more advanced, just drop us a line, we'll find something :wink:)

## How to get started

First of all, you need pretix running locally on your machine. We have a guide on the developer installation [over here](https://docs.pretix.eu/en/latest/development/setup.html). Play around with it and get a feeling for what pretix is and how it works :) Try to find the places in the interface mentioned in this issue where something needs to change. Maybe try to find the same places in the code? Just searching for characteristic words can be a powerful tool to find your way around.


## What this is about

Currently, when creating or editing an event, there is a free text field to enter a currency that accepts any inputs, for example one could enter both ``EUR`` and ``€``. However, when we communicate with APIs like PayPal, ``€`` will fail and only ``EUR`` will work. Therefore, the user also should only be able to input [ISO-4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) codes.

## How to do this

Go to ``pretix/base/models/event.py`` and add a [choice attribute](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.10/ref/models/fields/#choices) to the ``currency`` field of the ``Event`` model. Make sure the forms behave correctly when creating and modifying events. You could base the choices on [pycountry](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pycountry), so we don't need to keep a list of our own.

## I want to give it a try!

You're still reading, nice! If you want to try working on this, please comment below, so everyone else knows this is being looked at and can search for a different place to contribute. 

First, [fork](https://github.com/pretix/pretix/fork) the repository to your own GitHub account. Then clone it locally (or [set it as your remote](https://help.github.com/articles/configuring-a-remote-for-a-fork/) if you already cloned it earlier) and prepare your pull requests. There are a number of tutorials on the Pull Request workflow online, for example this [short version](https://guides.github.com/introduction/flow/) by GitHub itself and this [more in-depth tutorial](https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-create-a-pull-request-on-github). We're excited to see your pull request! 

And don't forget: If you get stuck, don't hestitate to ask. We bound ourselves to a [Code of Conduct](https://docs.pretix.eu/en/latest/development/contribution/codeofconduct.html) and we're committed to providing a welcoming experience and giving constructive, friendly and useful feedback on your contributions.

title: Event time with timezone
body:
It's actually a follow-up for #413.

>The rule of thumb in pretix (and Django) is: The database contains always UTC, the user always is shown and enters local time.

I asked this question because I found something interesting when creating event.
The scenarios are as follows:
1) Create new event using timezone `Asia/Tokyo`
![create-tokyo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25281597/23635820/37274f74-0315-11e7-86dd-806d867e7323.png)
After save:
![saved-tokyo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25281597/23635825/412aecc4-0315-11e7-90a7-51f940b411b0.png)
Both start and end time were changed with respect to the timezone I set. 
From **11:19:59 (GMT+9)** to **20:19:59 (GMT+9)**.
I guess we consider the start and end time as UTC time by default regardless of the timezone we set.

2) Change time only
![timezone-unchanged](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25281597/23635947/feb85506-0315-11e7-9a84-cd9fc51c33e3.png)
As expected, it works well.

3) Change timezone of an existing event
![change timezone](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25281597/23635955/0df7829e-0316-11e7-9ccb-60d0fb54efb2.png)
This time I changed the timezone from `Asia/Tokyo`(GMT+9) to `Asia/Singapore`(GMT+8).
![saved timezone](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25281597/23635976/2da3fff0-0316-11e7-8f6a-2ddcce9f21c3.png)
Both times were changed from **08:50:56** to **07:50:56**.

I am quite new to pretix and not sure whether this kind of behaviour is expected.
From my opinion, I think user will only set event time using local time, which means it's better to include timezone value before we save data to database.

title: Stripe: Refund after a double payment invalidates order
body:
Scenario:

1. There is some bug (e.g. #332) that leads to a payment being charged twice to a user's card
2. One of the two payments is refunded via Stripe's web interface
3. Stripe sends the refund event to our webhook endpoint
4. pretix marks the ticket as refunded and ... it's gone, even though it is still paid.

I'm not sure how we should solve this. We probably need to track Stripe payments in much more detail, i.e. keep a record of all charge objects we created and do clever logic when the refund event happens.

title: Validate the last date of payments
body:
If the last date of payments is set to a value *before* the end of the presale period, users can buy tickets but never pay them. This is probably not a situation anyone wants to have :)

We should validate in the settings form that this cannot be set this way.

title: Send consistent metadata to PayPal
body:
We have two problems here:

- [x] The current PayPal implementation is lazy and sends different metadata to PayPal in ``order_prepare`` and ``checkout_prepare``

- [x] As ``checkout_prepare`` does not know the order code yet, it is not contained in the meta data which makes debugging hard. We need to consider if we can [update](https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/payments/#payment_update) the payment with the order code without needing to re-authorize it.

title: Separate JS file for translation can make at least some pages stop working
body:
(Originally reported in a twitter conversation with @nomoketo.)

When the serving side of the app is not reliable (e.g. irregularly collapsing under load) it is possible for only part of the JavaScript to load. This can be a problem in some pages (for example the confirmation page) as the buttons actions are rebound to use AJAX, but the bound functions use interfaces defined in other JS files that might not have loaded.

In particular, during 33C3 launch I observed the "Place binding order" button not working when "/jsi18n/en/" was not loading (due to the webserver timing out.) This file is very small, and not minified, it contains some basic formatting constants and the definition of `gettext()`-style functions. Since the bound function for the AJAX request does use `gettext()`, it won't be able to find it in the loaded JS and will thus fail to execute anything at all.

To compound the issue at least in the 33C3 deployment this is the sole file that is not under `/static/CACHE`, which probably also means it's not cached client-side, so will keep failing even if once it loaded correctly. Unfortunately I didn't take a full request trace so I can't confirm this last part.

title: CSP-compliant error pages
body: Our error pages (404, 403, ...) contain links to e.g. `javascript:history.back()` that won't work due to our [Content Security Policy](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Content_Security_Policy) headers that forbid javascript: URLs or `<script>` tags. The solution would be to move those JavaScript lines into a seperate `.js` file that is loaded by the error page and attaches those handlers to the links.

title: Process-local cache is dangerous!
body:
If neither memcached or redis are installed, pretix currently uses local memory for caching. This is highly dangerous, as we currently rely on cache invalidation for certain things.

We should either turn off caching completely without memcached or redis, or rely less on invalidation.

This was a huge problem as we cached session data which lead to inconsistent sessions. This is fixed in 8dd7b58.

title: Activating ticket download feature does not work
enable-Checkbox for payment providers is always checked
"Shop is live"-Flag
body:
There should be a button or checkbox to take the whole shop up or down. If it is down, it should be only visible to the admin.

This might be easily implemented as a event setting.

In a second step, a checklist of actions might be enforced before going live, e.g. at least one payment provider selected.

title: Correct handling of required=True
body: Currently, when a payment provider defines input fields with required=True, they will be rendered with the required=required HTML attribute. This is bad, as there are often multiple payment providers on one page and the user shouldn't need to fill out _all_ of them.

title: Retain answers when re-adding items
body: If you have an _expired_ `CartPosition` and you try to add _something else_ to your cart, pretix will try to renew all your `CartPositions` in order to have a common expiration time for all of them (for user convenience). Currently, this happens by them being removed and added like new positions. This loses all existing information like `attendee_name` or existion `QuestionAnswer` objects (which should be retained).

title: Required boolean question
body: A required question of type boolean should require the user to select either Yes or No, but currently requires the user to select Yes (because the checkbox is otherwise not checked). A SelectInput could be the solution to this.
